title: Momentum - small block colliding with large block

content.question: Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math> is sliding to the right at a speed of <math alttext="v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> along a table towards stationary Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> of mass <math alttext="m sub B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub></math>, where <math alttext="m sub B is greater than m sub A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>B</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub></math>. Friction between both blocks and the table surface is negligible. A spring is attached to the left of Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math>, as shown in the figure. Block <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> collides with Block <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> and compresses the spring. At the instant the spring is at its maximum compression, how does the total momentum <math alttext="the sum of p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Σ</mtext><mi>p</mi></math> of the two-block system compare to <math alttext="m sub A, end sub, v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and what is the justification of this answer?

choices.label: <math alttext="the sum of p equals m sub A, end sub, v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Σ</mtext><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because there is no net external force acting on the system.

<math alttext="the sum of p equals m sub A, end sub, v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Σ</mtext><mi>p</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because there is a net external force acting on the system.

<math alttext="the sum of p is not equal to m sub A, end sub, v sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Σ</mtext><mi>p</mi><mo>≠</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mtext>A</mtext></msub><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, because there is no net external force acting on the system.
